info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 3:16PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow will affect Henry county through 430 PM CST... At 314 PM CST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from Hooppole to near Rio. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Visibilities less than a quarter of a mile and winds in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams IMPACTS...Snow covered surfaces including roadways, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks. Difficulty seeing while driving. Quick Accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are expected in next hour and a half. Locations impacted include... Kewanee, Cambridge, Geneseo, Galva, Atkinson, Annawan, Woodhull, Alpha, Andover, Hooppole, Lynn Center, Osco, Bishop Hill, Henry County Fairgrounds, Ophiem, German Corner, Nekoma, Kewanee Municipal Airport, Ulah and Johnson-Sauk Trail State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 17 and 35. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 20 and 33. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
